verbLexeme: 1. To be in the middle of a place or area. English = (be) central.
2. Of a place, to be easy to reach because it is in the centre of a city. English = (be) central.
nominalLexeme: 1. The middle of something. English = centre.
2. A building where people have meetings, get help of some kind, or take part in a particular activity. English = centre.
3. In rugby football, one of the two middle players in the three-quarter line. English = centre.
